ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: A wealthy knowledge of Egyptian culture and the language, different ways to interpret it, and how to translate symbols into english sentences.
the basics behind reading and writhing Middle Egyptian Hieroglyphs
Knowledge of the hieroglyphic script and Egyptian grammar.
I learned the basics of Ancient Egyptian grammar.
Good introduction to the methods of reading and interpreting Middle Egyptian hieroglyphics. Very grammar heavy.
I learned basic Middle Egyptian grammar and vocabulary.
I learned the basics of middle egyptian
Had fun learning to read Egyptian!

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: It is nice that it's in a small group, however the workload sometimes is overbearing.

Strength = Very engaging and interesting material
Weakness = taught too fast and covers too much

Strengths: Interesting material
Weaknesses: Should meet more often, instructor goes too fast, homeworks are not very helpful, content not presenting in a very engaging way.
The course should include more vocabulary repetition (quizzes, worksheets, games, etc.).

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, it's a fun and engaging/interesting way to learn a new language.
Yes but only because it satisfies the language requirement, I wouldn't have taken it otherwise
Yes. Besides simply being cool, Egyptian is a great course to take for people interested in ancient languages or anyone who enjoys the intellectual side of languages without the speech component.

I would probably not recommend this course if you are just looking for an easy language requirement. There are other classes better for that. This class is better for someone who is actually interested in hieroglyphics as the workload can be a lot with the vocab and the instructor goes quite quick.
Yes--grading is easy but content-wise it's not a gut. Take it if you're genuinely interested in hieroglyphics.
